intro: Spiraea glomerata, commonly known as clustered spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It features slender, arching stems that bear clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers in early to mid-summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically gray-green in color and turn red in the fall. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Spiraea glomerata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
